The case of Tina Tully (also known as Tiny) remains fresh in the minds of all residents.&nbsp; Tina Tully, eight years old, was recently accused of a series of thefts of musical instruments.&nbsp; When local police eventually caught Tina in the act, she confessed, explaining that she was only &ldquo;borrowing&rdquo; one instrument at a time.&nbsp; It happens that she longed to play an instrument, but was not sure which one to choose.&nbsp; So, during a period of several days she sampled a number of musical possibilities, somehow avoiding detection by the staff. She eventually settled on the tuba.&nbsp; When questioned, Tina expressed sadness that her three older brothers had been given access to music lessons while in the local schools.&nbsp; Budget cuts forced the elimination of music programs, so Tina took matters into her own hands.&nbsp; What&rsquo;s a music store owner and police chief to do?&nbsp; That&rsquo;s easy: Tina was forgiven and will perform community service at Tooters weekly for the next three months.&nbsp; Best of all, the store has donated a tuba rental and music lessons to Tina.&nbsp; Happy ending? Not so cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>The day the music died&mdash;we have lost something.&nbsp; </strong>It is not difficult to establish a connection between this incident and the loss of music programs in our schools.&nbsp; Prior to 2012, students enjoyed many opportunities to participate in music activities, including weekly music class from a certified teacher; optional, free lessons on an instrument of their choice; affordable rentals with an option to buy the instrument; and joining the chorus, a performance orchestra, the marching band, or small, select instrumental groups.&nbsp;&nbsp; Students also could receive counseling and advice offered by music professionals at all schools in our city.&nbsp; Few people are aware that when it was decided to cut a program, the choice was either drama or music.&nbsp; The music program took the hit for the team.&nbsp; We need to bring music back to the schools.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Based
